definitions.definition: An unspecified example of (something); the indefinite article . [from before 1150]
examples: There was a man here looking for you yesterday.

definitions.definition: One; used before score , dozen , hundred , thousand , million , etc.
examples: I've seen it happen a hundred times.

definitions.definition: Used in some phrases denoting quantity, such as a few , a good many , a couple , a little , a bit , etc.
examples: He's a bit thick, isn't he?
They asked me a few questions.
There are a few hundred orders that need to be fulfilled by tomorrow.

definitions.definition: Used in some adverbial phrases denoting the degree or extent of an action , such as a little , a bit , a lot , etc.
examples: The door was opened a little.

definitions.definition: The same; one and the same . Used in phrases such as of a kind , birds of a feather , etc.
examples: We are of a mind on matters of morals.

definitions.definition: Any ; every ; used before a noun which has become modified to limit its scope.
examples: A man who dies intestate leaves his children troubles and difficulties.

definitions.definition: Any ; used with a negative to indicate not a single one.
examples: It was so dark that we couldn't see a thing.
He fell all that way, and hasn't a bump on his head?

definitions.definition: Used before an adjective that modifies a noun (singular or plural) delimited by a numeral.
examples: The lottery jackpot is worth a staggering three hundred million dollars.
The holidays are a mere one week away.

definitions.definition: One; someone named; used before a person's name, suggesting that the speaker knows little about the person other than the name.
examples: We've received an interesting letter from a Mrs. Miggins of London.

definitions.definition: Used before an adjective modifying a person's name, typically used to emphasize that person's current condition or emotional state.
Someone or something like; similar to; used before a proper noun to create an example out of it .
examples: The center of the village was becoming a Times Square.
The man is a regular Romeo.
